intro: Onosma alburzensis, commonly known as the Alburz onosma, is a flowering plant native to the Alborz Mountains in Iran. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to temperate climates. It is often found in open habitats such as slopes and meadows. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
